trans-unit.source: Script Action development with HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Script Action development with HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Script Actions are a way to customize Azure HDInsight clusters by specifying cluster configuration settings during installation, or installing additional services, tools, or other software on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Script Actions are a way to customize Azure HDInsight clusters by specifying cluster configuration settings during installation, or installing additional services, tools, or other software on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The information in this document is specific to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The information in this document is specific to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: For information on using Script Actions with Windows-based clusters, see [Script action development with HDInsight (Windows)](hdinsight-hadoop-script-actions.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on using Script Actions with Windows-based clusters, see [Script action development with HDInsight (Windows)](hdinsight-hadoop-script-actions.md).

trans-unit.source: What are Script Actions?
trans-unit.target: What are Script Actions?

trans-unit.source: Script actions are Bash scripts that run on the cluster nodes during provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Script actions are Bash scripts that run on the cluster nodes during provisioning.

trans-unit.source: A script action is executed as root, and provides full access rights to the cluster nodes.
trans-unit.target: A script action is executed as root, and provides full access rights to the cluster nodes.

trans-unit.source: Script Action can be used when provisioning a cluster using the __Azure preview portal__, __Azure PowerShell__, or the __HDInsight .NET SDK__.
trans-unit.target: Script Action can be used when provisioning a cluster using the __Azure preview portal__, __Azure PowerShell__, or the __HDInsight .NET SDK__.

trans-unit.source: For an walkthrough of customizing a cluster using Script Actions, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using script actions](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: For an walkthrough of customizing a cluster using Script Actions, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using script actions](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: Users should make sure that all of the scripts and resources used by the script remain available throughout the lifetime of the cluster and that the versions of these files do not change for the duration.
trans-unit.target: Users should make sure that all of the scripts and resources used by the script remain available throughout the lifetime of the cluster and that the versions of these files do not change for the duration.

trans-unit.source: These resources are required if the nodes in the cluster are re-imaged.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the cluster customization script is idempotent
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the cluster customization script is idempotent

trans-unit.source: You must expect that the nodes of an HDInsight cluster will be re-imaged during the cluster lifetime, and that the cluster customization script will be used when this happens.
trans-unit.target: You must expect that the nodes of an HDInsight cluster will be re-imaged during the cluster lifetime, and that the cluster customization script will be used when this happens.

trans-unit.source: The script must be designed to be idempotent in the sense that upon re-imaging, the script should ensure that the cluster is returned to the same state every time it is ran.
trans-unit.target: The script must be designed to be idempotent in the sense that upon re-imaging, the script should ensure that the cluster is returned to the same state every time it is ran.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a custom script installs an application at /usr/local/bin on its first run, then on each subsequent run the script should check whether the application already exists at the /usr/local/bin location before proceeding with other steps in the script.
trans-unit.target: For example, if a custom script installs an application at /usr/local/bin on its first run, then on each subsequent run the script should check whether the application already exists at the /usr/local/bin location before proceeding with other steps in the script.

trans-unit.source: Ensure high availability of the cluster architecture
trans-unit.target: Ensure high availability of the cluster architecture

trans-unit.source: Linux-based HDInsight clusters provides two head nodes that are active within the cluster, and Script Actions are ran for both nodes.
trans-unit.target: Linux-based HDInsight clusters provides two head nodes that are active within the cluster, and Script Actions are ran for both nodes.

trans-unit.source: If the components you install expect only one head node, you must design a script that will only install the component on one of the two head nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: If the components you install expect only one head node, you must design a script that will only install the component on one of the two head nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The head nodes are named **headnode0** and **headnode1**.
trans-unit.target: The head nodes are named **headnode0** and **headnode1**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Default services installed as part of HDInsight are designed to fail over between the two head nodes as needed, however this functionality is not extended to custom components installed through Script Actions.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Default services installed as part of HDInsight are designed to fail over between the two head nodes as needed, however this functionality is not extended to custom components installed through Script Actions.

trans-unit.source: If you need the components installed through a Script Action to be highly available, you must implement your own failover mechanism that uses the two available head nodes.
trans-unit.target: If you need the components installed through a Script Action to be highly available, you must implement your own failover mechanism that uses the two available head nodes.

trans-unit.target: Parameters passed to the script are known as _positional parameters_, and are assigned to `$1` for the first parameter, `$2` for the second, and so-on.

trans-unit.source: Put the files that contain the custom scripts in a place that is accessible by the cluster nodes during deployment.
trans-unit.target: Put the files that contain the custom scripts in a place that is accessible by the cluster nodes during deployment.
